data.title: Chris Kaman and the Trail Blazers: A quick look at Portland's incoming big man
data.meta_description: A quick look at Chris Kaman, who reached an agreement on a two-year deal with the Trail Blazers.
data.text:
The Portland Trail Blazers made their first move of the offseason, reaching an agreement with free agent center Chris Kaman last Thursday, adding depth and experience to the frontcourt.

The deal, which will become official when the NBA free agency moratorium ends on July 10, is worth $9.8 million over two years, according to The Oregonian's Joe Freeman:

Below is a quick look at the Blazers' newest addition, and be sure to check out Freeman's posts on the signing and notes from his conversation with Kaman.

Chris Kaman

Center | 7-0, 265

Age: 32

Twitter: @ChrisKaman

College: Central Michigan

NBA experience: 11 years

Drafted with the No. 6 pick by the Los Angeles Clippers in the 2003 draft

Previous teams: Clippers (2003-11); New Orleans Hornets (2011-12); Dallas Mavericks (2012-13); Los Angeles Lakers (2013-14)

Kaman was part of the 2011 trade, along with forward Al-Farouq Aminu, guard Eric Gordon and a 2012 first-round draft pick, that brought Chris Paul to the Clippers, along with two 2015 second-round picks, from the Hornets.

Last season: 10.4 points and 5.9 rebounds per game; appeared in just 39 games (13 starts) and averaged a career-low 18.9 minutes.

Best season: 18.5 points, 9.3 rebounds, 1.6 assists and 1.2 blocks per game in 2009-10, earning All-Star honors. Averaged a career-bests of 12.7 rebounds and 2.8 blocks in 2007-08.

Career: 11.7 points, 7.9 rebounds and 1.4 blocks, while shooting 49 percent in 11 seasons.

Role with the Blazers: Shoring up the backup center spot behind starter Robin Lopez

Quotable: "I'm a utility guy. I don't think I'm a superstar at any one thing, but I'm a well-rounded basketball player and I have a lot of knowledge of the game. ... I shoot the ball well outside, I post-up well. I'm an underrated shot-blocker. And I rebound."
